newsitem.title: MEXICO: RESEARCH ALERT - Serfin cut to sell.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Serfin cut to sell.

text.p: ING Barings said on Wednesday it downgraded Grupo Financiero Serfin to sell from buy because of negative fourth quarter results.
The brokerage said it reiterated its sell rating on the company's American Depositary Receipts.

"The strong decline in equity and the imminent dilution announced in relation to the sale of loans to (bank insurance fund) Fobaproa have caused a strong shift in the bank's valuation which we find is not sustainable going forward," the brokerage said.
Under newly applied U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), the bank posted 22.6 percent past-due loans to total loans at the end of February 1997, it added.
ING Barings predicted the prices of both its ADR and Mexico shares will decline over the next 12 months.
Serfin's shares in Mexico closed at 3.45 pesos on Tuesday. ADRs were trading down 1/8 to 4 at mid-morning.
